ecto_rbo_pcl¶

RemoveNaNFromPointCloud¶

Brief doc

Remove all NaNs from the point cloud.

Parameters

  • construct_pointcloud   type: bool    not required   default: True

    Construct the pointcloud and provid it as output or just the indices.

Inputs

  • input   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud   

    The cloud to filter

Outputs

  • indices   type: pcl::PointIndices   

    Filtered indices.

  • output   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud   

    Filtered Cloud.

    Should the resulting vector be negated.

Outputs

  • vectors   type: std::vector<Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 2, 3, 1>, std::allocator<Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 2, 3, 1> > >   

    The selected column vector.

  • cluster_1   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Cluster that should be part of the merger.

  • cluster_2   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Cluster that should be part of the merger.

  • cluster_3   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Cluster that should be part of the merger.

  • cluster_4   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Cluster that should be part of the merger.

  • cluster_5   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Cluster that should be part of the merger.

  • cluster_6   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Cluster that should be part of the merger.

  • cluster_7   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Cluster that should be part of the merger.

  • cluster_8   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Cluster that should be part of the merger.

  • cluster_9   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Cluster that should be part of the merger.

Outputs

  • merged_clusters   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >

FloodFill¶

Brief doc

Does the flood fill segmentation algorithm.

Parameters

  • angular_threshold   type: double    not required   default: 0.52359879

    Angular difference (in rad) between the normals of two neighboring points.

  • comparator_type   type: int    not required   default: 0

    0 = curvature_comparator, 1 = edge_comparator, 2 = curvature_comparator

  • curvature_distance_threshold   type: double    not required   default: 0.07

    Difference in curvature between two neighboring points.

  • curvature_threshold   type: double    not required   default: 0.07

    Maximum curvature of a point.

  • distance_threshold   type: double    not required   default: 0.05

    Maximum distance between two neighboring points in the same cluster.

  • min_inliers   type: int    not required   default: 100

    Number of minimum points a cluster must contain.

  • normal_distance_threshold   type: double    not required   default: 0.12

    Distance between two neighboring points along their normals.

  • publish_rviz_markers   type: bool    not required   default: False

    Should the output be published for visualization?

Inputs

  • input   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud   

    Input cloud.

  • normals   type: ecto::pcl::FeatureCloud   

    Normals to use.

Outputs

  • clusters   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Clusters indices.

  • inliers   type: pcl::PointIndices   

    Points that belong to some cluster.

  • unclustered   type: pcl::PointIndices   

    Point indices that do not belong to any cluster.

PlaneFits2D¶

Brief doc

Plane Fitting using smallest enclosing rectangle.

Parameters

  • max_aspect_ratio   type: double    not required   default: 3.40282346639e+38

    Filters out all boxes with maximum aspect ratio (= longer side / shorter side; between 1 and inf).

  • min_aspect_ratio   type: double    not required   default: 1.0

    Filters out all boxes with minimum aspect ratio (= longer side / shorter side; between 1 and inf).

  • publish_rviz_markers   type: bool    not required   default: False

    Should the output be published for visualization?

Inputs

  • clusters   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Point Cloud clusters.

  • height_origin   type: Eigen::Matrix<float, 4, 1, 2, 4, 1>   

    If this is supplied, then calculate height of bounding box based on the largest distance of any point to this point along the normal

  • input   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud   

    The cloud to filter

  • normal   type: Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 2, 3, 1>   

    Normal vector of all 2d bounding box footprints.

Outputs

  • sizes   type: std::vector<Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 2, 3, 1>, std::allocator<Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 2, 3, 1> > >   

    Bounding box sizes.

  • transforms   type: std::vector<Eigen::Transform<float, 3, 2, 2>, std::allocator<Eigen::Transform<float, 3, 2, 2> > >   

    Bounding box transforms.

Message2PointCloud¶

Brief doc

Take a PointCloud Message and converts to pcl type.

Parameters

  • format   type: int    not required   default: 2

    Format of cloud to grab. Choices are: XYZ, XYZRGB (default)

Inputs

  • input   type: boost::shared_ptr<sensor_msgs::PointCloud2_<std::allocator<void> > const>   

    An ROS point cloud message.

Outputs

  • header   type: std_msgs::Header_<std::allocator<void> >   

    The header of the ros message.

  • output   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud   

    An XYZ/XYZRGB point cloud from the kinect

RegionGrowingRGB¶

Brief doc

Do the region growing segmentation algorithm.

Parameters

  • distance_threshold   type: double    not required   default: 10.0

    Used to determine whether the point is neighbouring or not. If the point is located at a distance less than the given threshold, then it is considered to be neighbouring. Used for clusters neighbours search.

  • min_cluster_size   type: int    not required   default: 10

    This value is similar to that which was used in the Region growing segmentation tutorial. In addition to that, it is used for merging process. If cluster has less points than was set through setMinClusterSize method, then it will be merged with the nearest neighbour.

  • point_color_threshold   type: double    not required   default: 6.0

    Color threshold. Just as angle threshold is used for testing points normals in pcl::RegionGrowing to determine if the point belongs to cluster, this value is used for testing points colors.

  • region_color_threshold   type: double    not required   default: 5.0

    Color threshold for clusters. This value is similar to the previous, but is used when the merging process takes place.

Inputs

  • indices   type: pcl::PointIndices   

    Point indices to consider (usually used to avoid NaNs in an organized pointcloud.

  • input   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud   

    The cloud to filter

Outputs

  • output   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Clusters indices.

BroadcastTF¶

Brief doc

Broadcast a specified transform to ROS.

Parameters

  • source_frame   type: std::string    required   default:

    The source frame to listen to.

  • target_frame   type: std::string    required   default:

    The target frame to listen to.

Inputs

  • timestamp   type: std_msgs::Header_<std::allocator<void> >   

    The timestamp for looking up the transform (not used).

  • transform   type: Eigen::Transform<float, 3, 2, 2>   

    The transform.

    Size of the long IFCO edge

  • ifco_width   type: double

Brief doc

PassThroughOrganized filter

Parameters

    Maximum value for the filter.

    Minimum value for the filter.

    To negate the limits or not.

    The cloud to filter

    Filtered Cloud.

PlaneFits¶

Brief doc

Plane Segmentation using Sample Consensus.

Parameters

  • distance_threshold   type: double    not required   default: 0.05

    Maximum mean error a plane fit may have.

  • max_size   type: double    not required   default: 0.24

  • min_boxness   type: double    not required   default: 0.8

  • min_inlier_ratio   type: double    not required   default: 0.5

    Minimum number of inlier points per plane.

  • min_size   type: double    not required   default: 0.08

  • polygon_approximation_epsilon   type: double    not required   default: 50.0

    Parameter for Douglas-Peucker algorithm that approximates the planar contour with a polygon (in mm).

  • publish_rviz_markers   type: bool    not required   default: False

    Should the output be published for visualization?

  • weight_contour   type: double    not required   default: 0.5

Inputs

  • clusters   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Point Cloud clusters.

  • input   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud   

    Input cloud.

  • normals   type: ecto::pcl::FeatureCloud   

    Normals to use.

Outputs

  • bounded_model_biggest   type: std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<pcl::ModelCoefficients const>, std::allocator<boost::shared_ptr<pcl::ModelCoefficients const> > >   

    Plane coefficients of the biggest plane

  • bounded_models   type: std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<pcl::ModelCoefficients const>, std::allocator<boost::shared_ptr<pcl::ModelCoefficients const> > >   

    Bounded plane coefficients: (x, y, z, normal_x, normal_y, normal_z, principal_axis_x, principal_axis_y, principal_axis_z, width

  • centroid_biggest   type: Eigen::Matrix<float, 4, 1, 2, 4, 1>   

    The centroid of the biggest plane found.

  • centroids   type: std::vector<Eigen::Matrix<float, 4, 1, 2, 4, 1>, std::allocator<Eigen::Matrix<float, 4, 1, 2, 4, 1> > >   

    Plane centroids.

  • fit_quality   type: std::vector<double, std::allocator<double> >   

    Goodness of fit.

  • inliers   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Point Cloud clusters.

  • models   type: std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<pcl::ModelCoefficients const>, std::allocator<boost::shared_ptr<pcl::ModelCoefficients const> > >   

    Plane coefficients

  • models_biggest   type: std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<pcl::ModelCoefficients const>, std::allocator<boost::shared_ptr<pcl::ModelCoefficients const> > >   

    Plane coefficients

  • polygon_biggest   type: std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<pcl::ModelCoefficients const>, std::allocator<boost::shared_ptr<pcl::ModelCoefficients const> > >   

    Plane coefficients

  • polygons   type: std::vector<boost::shared_ptr<pcl::ModelCoefficients const>, std::allocator<boost::shared_ptr<pcl::ModelCoefficients const> > >   

    Fitted 3D Polygons.

  • sizes   type: std::vector<Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 2, 3, 1>, std::allocator<Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 2, 3, 1> > >   

    Plane sizes.

  • transform_biggest   type: Eigen::Transform<float, 3, 2, 2>   

    The homogenous transformation of the biggest plane found.

  • transforms   type: std::vector<Eigen::Transform<float, 3, 2, 2>, std::allocator<Eigen::Transform<float, 3, 2, 2> > >   

    Plane transforms.

Parameters

Outputs

    The header of the ros message.

  • output   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud

NormalEstimationIntegral¶

Brief doc

Normal estimation using integral images

Parameters

  • estimation_method   type: int    not required   default: 0

    The estimation method to use: COVARIANCE_MATRIX(0), AVERAGE_3D_GRADIENT(1), AVERAGE_DEPTH_CHANGE(2).

  • max_depth_change_factor   type: double    not required   default: 0.00999999977648

    The max depth change factor.

  • publish_rviz_markers   type: bool    not required   default: False

    Should the output be published for visualization?

  • smoothing_size   type: double    not required   default: 15.0

    The smoothing size.

Inputs

  • input   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud   

    The cloud to filter

Outputs

  • output   type: ecto::pcl::FeatureCloud   

    Cloud of features.

FilterClustersByNormals¶

Brief doc

Filter clusters according to their mean surface normal.

Parameters

  • max_distance   type: double    not required   default: 20.0

    Maximum distance of a cluster normal to the input normal in degrees.

  • negate   type: bool    not required   default: True

    Maximum distance of a cluster normal to the input normal in degrees.

Inputs

  • clusters   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Cluster indices.

  • input   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud   

    Input cloud.

  • normals   type: ecto::pcl::FeatureCloud   

    Normals to use.

  • transform   type: Eigen::Transform<float, 3, 2, 2>   

    Pose.

Outputs

  • filtered_clusters   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Filtered clusters.

FilterClustersBySize¶

Brief doc

Filter clusters according to their size.

Parameters

  • filter_criterion   type: int    not required   default: 0

    Whether to cluster based on volume or number of points.

  • max_distance   type: double    not required   default: 0.2

    Maximum distance of a cluster to a specified point.

  • max_size   type: int    not required   default: 100000

    Minimum size of a cluster in number of points.

  • max_volume   type: double    not required   default: 0.0004

    Maximum size of a cluster in m^3.

  • min_size   type: int    not required   default: 100

    Minimum size of a cluster in number of points.

  • min_volume   type: double    not required   default: 8e-06

    Minimum size of a cluster in m^3.

Inputs

  • clusters   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Cluster indices.

  • input   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud   

    The cloud to filter

  • transform   type: Eigen::Transform<float, 3, 2, 2>   

    Pose.

Outputs

  • filtered_clusters   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Filtered clusters.

CropBox¶

Brief doc

Crops a box out of the input cloud, given a reference frame, a transform and a size vector.

Parameters

  • default_max   type: Eigen::Matrix<float, 4, 1, 2, 4, 1>    not required   default: [not visible from python]

    Maximum value for the filter.

  • default_min   type: Eigen::Matrix<float, 4, 1, 2, 4, 1>    not required   default: [not visible from python]

    Minimum value for the filter.

  • default_rotation   type: Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 2, 3, 1>    not required   default: [not visible from python]

    Rotation.

  • default_transform   type: Eigen::Transform<float, 3, 2, 2>    not required   default: [not visible from python]

    Transform.

  • default_translation   type: Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 2, 3, 1>    not required   default: [not visible from python]

    Translation.

  • keep_organized   type: bool    not required   default: True

    Should the output be organized?

  • publish_rviz_markers   type: bool    not required   default: False

    Should the output be published for visualization?

Inputs

  • input   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud   

    The cloud to filter

  • max   type: Eigen::Matrix<float, 4, 1, 2, 4, 1>   

    The max of the box.

  • min   type: Eigen::Matrix<float, 4, 1, 2, 4, 1>   

    The min of the box.

  • rotation   type: Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 2, 3, 1>   

    The rotation of the box w.r.t. the reference frame.

  • transform   type: Eigen::Transform<float, 3, 2, 2>   

    The reference frame of the box.

  • translation   type: Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 2, 3, 1>   

    The translation of the box w.r.t. the reference frame.

Outputs

  • box   type: boost::shared_ptr<pcl::ModelCoefficients const>   

    Box used to crop points.

  • indices   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Point Cloud clusters.

  • indices2   type: pcl::PointIndices   

    Point Cloud indices.

  • output   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud   

    Filtered Cloud.

ExtractClosestCluster¶

Brief doc

Extract a point cloud corresponding to the closest cluster.

Parameters

  • size_weight   type: double    not required   no default value

    If set, distance will be influenced by the cluster size by this factor (size_weight < 0: prefer larger clusters that still are further away)

Inputs

  • clusters   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Clusters indices.

  • input   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud   

    The cloud to filter

  • transform   type: Eigen::Transform<float, 3, 2, 2>   

    Pose to which the closest cluster (centroid) is selected.

  • transform_2   type: Eigen::Transform<float, 3, 2, 2>   

    Another pose. If this is given the closest cluster is defined as the one which minimizes: |Pose1 - X| + |Pose2 - x|

Outputs

  • closest_cluster   type: std::vector<pcl::PointIndices, std::allocator<pcl::PointIndices> >   

    Closest cluster indices.

  • output   type: ecto::pcl::PointCloud   

    Filtered Cloud.

    The vector of transforms.

    The first element of the input vector.
